Posts.Content: Thanks Emma yes I truly do owe my life to my kitten. If I had a quid for every time a someone said to me "oh your looking really well" I would be rich.How does a cancer patient look like,are we given a picture telling us we should look like Gollum and every time some hair falls out we scream " my precious". I lost a lot of friends when I was diagnosed but they can all take a long walk off a short pier. How are you all girls I mean really,not the I'm ok mask. I mean the one we let fall in front of others like us? I'm angry,sad,depressed,tired and just want it over now. Plz girls feel free to friend add me,I'm a great listener. Xxxxxx Thanks for your comments ladies xxxx
Posts.Title: Fed up

Posts.Content: Hi Canton think from what I can remember it was the size of a small fist xxxx¬†
Posts.Title: Fed up

Posts.Content: Hi all Well I'm totally fed up,May 2012 I was diagnosed with grade 3 aggressive breast cancer. Had lumpectomy and lymph nodes removed,a 5oz lump was taken out of me Had chemo which was horrible I wanted to give up,had radiotherapy which was ok. Now having Herceptin until March 2014. Was told by my surgeon that if my kitten (long story) hadn't sensed my Cancer I would not be here now. I have good days and bad days,I had two strokes 2009 and also have Fibromyalgia and Myalgia Encephalomyelitis. Because I don't always have a smile on my face 24/7 ppl are having a go at me saying I'm wallowing in my cancer. But hey hang on they don't know the struggle I have gone through,the fear of dying,my cancer coming back which I have been told is a possibility. Do you think I have the right to have down and depressed days or should I always be happy happy joy joy all the time? Thnx xxxx
Posts.Title: Fed up

Posts.Content: Hi all During having fec my veins collapsed and some became corded so had to have a pic line put in to finish off the fec and then to have Herceptin. I finished all my treatment in May 2014 and a few of my veins are still corded and some are still collapsed but the thing is I get the most horrible pain in that arm now that sometimes it makes me feel sick. It also goes to my fingers,which then my fingers seem to swell up and go weak. Does anyone else suffer from this if so what have you done about it any help or ideas will be greatly received. Love and light all, keep smiling and fighting¬† Early I know but Merry Christmas and I hope you all have a great 2015 Xxx¬†
Posts.Title: Corded vein pain

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed with breast cancer in june 2012. I had a wide local excision and lymph nodes removed. For the past 17mth its been hospital's,scans,bloods,treatments,oncologists,cardiologists and surgeons. I could walk around my hospital blindfolded and find the right rooms needed. I am so fed up of it cos its taken over my life and I know nothing will ever be the same again and on top of that I have fibromyalgia and M.E. and also disabled due to a stroke in 2009. My life fe has been nothing but c**p since 2009 with illness and now breast cancer. Its so hard holding everything together,getting up in the morning and acting like all is ok. When some days all I want to do is curl up and sleep and not wake up. ‚ô•‚ô•
Posts.Title: Feeling fed up of treatment and hospitals.

Posts.Content: Yvonne hun your not being silly at all. I broke my wrist back in October and used to get so frustrated with myself especially having a bath or shower as I also had a picc line in and cldnt get any of them wet. I used to look like I was playing aeroplanes with keeping both arms outside the shower or bath.. When I was first diagnosed with breast cancer I cried buckets and asked for my mum, my hubby went to call my mum until I said not that mum I want my other mum. So hubby had to call my stepmum. Don't be sorry about not being able to pull yourself together, we have all been there so we understand hun. Big hugs hunni xxxx¬†
Posts.Title: I want my mum n dad

Posts.Content: Hi Nic Its possible to get breast cancer at any age. Cancer is not an age related disease. You have done the right thing by getting it checked out. You will have a mammogram on Monday and the Drs will work out from that what is wrong, you might have to have a biopsy, but you shld be told that day whether or not you have breast cancer. Fingers crossed you don't hun but if you do believe me you will be in the right place and the care you get is amazing. They are with you right through the whole process. Good luck for Monday, keep posted xxx¬†
Posts.Title: is this normal? not possible surely?

Posts.Content: Hi Mandi welcome but sorry you have to here. How are you coping? If you want to friend request me feel free too xxx¬†
Posts.Title: Im New

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Try soaking your nails in lemon juice that usually brings them back to their normal colour. My nails went yellow but for years I have been putting lemon juice into a bowl and soaking my nails in it for about 10-15 min twice a week and it shld bring them back to normal. Hope it helps hun xx¬†
Posts.Title: Yellow nails

Posts.Content: Not on any hormone tablets as my cancer was caused by them. Not taking Tamoxifen or any inhibitors. They only started after my 2nd treatment of F.E.C and then carried on through all my treatment and still carrying on now. üêáüê∞ xx¬†
Posts.Title: Stupid headaches

Posts.Content: Hi all I finished my treatment in march (have not been given all clear yet). Since then every so often I get really bad headaches. They get so bad they put me in bed all day. I know they are not migraines as I used to have them and they are nothing like that. Does anyone else have this problem if so, what have you done about it and have you contacted the hospital. Xxx¬†
Posts.Title: Stupid headaches

Posts.Content: Hi hun yes this is totally normal as you get yourself all psyched up for the chemo and then getting told you can't have it because your not well it feels like you have been dropped on the floor. Have the treatment hun you will be okay your emotions will be all over the place you will have days were you feel on top of the world, then the next day you will feel as though your at the bottom of a pit. Keep positive hunni xxx¬†
Posts.Title: hospital

Posts.Content: Hi¬† Yesterday I had my first mammogram results after my operation. I was diagnosed with 3rd degree breast cancer caused by my doctor leaving me on hrt for too long and not giving me a break every five yrs like she should have. The hrt was feeding the cancer. Anyway back to what I wanted to ask. Yes sorry I blabber ;) Anyway yesterday I got my results and they were clear. I'm still having treatment, I have had fec,radiotherapy and now Herceptin. After I got my results I felt nothing. Do any of you know why I felt nothing? I told people the results and they were pleased for me and stuff,but I still felt nothing and don't feel anything now,shouldn't I be jumping for joy or something? I have to go back every six months then have a mammogram every twelve months for the next 7 years. But I still don't know how I'm going to feel every time they tell me something. What is wrong with me?
Posts.Title: How are you supposed to feel

Posts.Content: We fight this stupid heinous disease to survive, yet every day for the rest of our lives we are reminded every flipping day from our scars and the crap it leaves behind. Because my breast cancer was so deep my surgeon told me when he opened me up,he had to cut down as far as my back to remove the "Nasty". Now I am left in pain and agony under the bottom of my shoulder exactly opposite my scar, so yay me along with all my other illnesses I now have this stupid inner pain to deal with. I had lymph nodes removed and along with a stroke I had I still don't have full strength in my right arm and quite a few times have gone to lift my arm and got it stuck or pulled my back. Chemo messed up my eating, I still can't stomach certain foods, radiotherapy has left a shadow on my lung, and I'm still waiting to see what side effects come out after having Herceptin. Sometimes I think it would have been easier to let the cancer take me. My husband even said to me the other day " Your not ill, cos your not in bed". I could have punched him. Apart from breast cancer I have Fibromyalgia and Myalgia Encephalomyelitis, partially sighted in my left eye and have a left side disability both from my stroke, but I'm not ill. We have had blazing rows twice in the last two weeks, he has told me I don't do anything, hang on when I do stuff he is forever telling me to take it easy cos he doesn't want me to get tired. Keeps telling me he does everything for me (again hang on he my full time carer) and that if he left I wouldn't be able to cope. I love him but sometimes I wish he would just f*** off and leave,cos it would be less stress. He spits his dummy out at the slightest thing its like rearing a child again. I can't win I sometimes wish the cancer had taken me, cos sometimes I can't bear to be alive. I'm fed up of fighting for my life and being accused of being lazy. I'm at my wits end¬† Xxx Keep fighting Xxx¬†
Posts.Title: Stupid disease

Posts.Content: Your hair can take up to six months to start growing back.After 9 month I still have short hair but it does come back its just a waiting game. I had mousy straight hair but now its coming back darker and curly. Now I look like my mum ha ha xxx
Posts.Title: How soon will I get some hair?

Posts.Content: Hi hunni wigs are totally up to you as are scarves and hats if you want or don't want to wear them. Some cancer units have people who provide wigs or scarves. You will be told all of this when you start chemo if not don't be afraid to ask. You might get a sore mouth during chemo,so a good mouthwash and a soft toothbrush i.e a baby's one is good ask in the cancer unit for mouthwash they will usually supply it,make sure you have plenty of immodium which again is usually supplied. For my sore mouth I bought this of pineapple drained them,froze them then sucked on them. There is some enzyme in pineapple that is good for chemo mouth. You will also get chemo brain, which will make you forget some things and you will feel like you have a muzzy head. Don't worry about it. Don't drink bottled water as something in that can affect the chemo. Creams any aqueous cream is good for the sunburn effect you get from radiotherapy. Flu jabs are not given to anyone having treatment for cancer. Don't use deodorant or scented soap. Never heard of black nail varnish. The only other thing you can do is listen to your body as it will tell you when you need to rest. Rest as much as you can as chemo will take it out of you even stay in bed all day or for as long as you want,don't be ashamed to. During chemo keep away from anybody who is unwell in anyway even a simple cold could put you in hospital. But most of all Good luck xxxxx¬†
Posts.Title: Lists - what do I need???

Posts.Content: Bottled water contains natural bacteria which can actually be harmful to ppl undergoing chemo. I asked my oncologist the exact same question and that is what he told me and when I looked it up it was right.¬† Again when asked for my flu jab I had a straight flat No as its putting the flu virus into your body but double check with your go. I will find my paperwork and find out why I cldnt have it x¬† Mine doesn't say why I wasn't allowed to have it but I have just read somewhere that you can have it. Hope this helps x¬†
Posts.Title: Lists - what do I need???

Posts.Content: Hi I went exactly the same during my rad treatment. I mentioned it to one of the rad nurses and they sorted it out for me to see a nurse and my oncologist and they noticed that the rad treatment was causing my skin to split. They gave me some cortisone cream that healed it straight away. ¬†Don't be afraid to speak to your rad team hun they are used to it. They would rather you mention stuff than suffer in silence. Oh and nobody can smell it we only can because any change to us is more noticeable now by ourselves. Xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and underarm is smelling

Posts.Content: Hi ladies get your breast nurse to refer you to a Macmillan nurse and Macmillan themselves as Macmillan and their nurses are amazing in giving you the support you need. There is nothing wrong in staying in bed or even becoming a semi pro couch potato, I'm becoming a master at it. My hubby forever has a go at me because I don't wake him until I explained sometimes I like to be alone just to rest my mind from everything that is going on in my mind. Ladies when you need to rest,chill or be alone just do it, it really is good to do it. Keep strong xxx¬†
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Hi Jan its because of the cancer,when we are told we have it for some reason we become more alert concerning our bodies and notice things more. The tiredness is the same and its also our bodies way of saying rest and while we are fighting this heinous disease we need to listen to it. Good luck and keep strong xxx¬† Water bottle or heat pad for your feet xxx¬†
Posts.Title: Feeling tired

Posts.Content: Hey Barbaraberry glad you have found us. I'm a grade 3 aggressive HER2 positive too. But no mastectomy as my surgeon said because I have an ample bosom, he could wok with it so that I didn't need one. Lol Nice being told by a doctor you got a nice rack when ya feeling like crap is good lol. What is sleep? I have not slept properly in 17mths. My doctor has prescribed me sleepers but they don't work, I have tried pillows and no pillows. My hubby put pillows under the mattress on the side I sleep so it raised it slightly. Then put pillows behind my back so I didn't roll over to much then made a sausage out of a quilt and put it under the sdide I couldn't sleep on. I put my leg and arm over it like I was hugging it and tried to sleep like that. I did manage to get a few hours of sleep but I also have other illnesses that do prevent me from sleeping. Give it a go hun Keep up the fight ppl xxxx¬†
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy I totally agree with you but I think the age should be dropped to 18. As soon as a girl hits 18 she should be sent for a mammogram. Especially if there is a history of breast cancer within the family. I think it should be the same for all cancer's. I would sign a petition xxx
Posts.Title: Should we petition for routine mammograms to be offered for over 40...

Posts.Content: Hi beevergirl get your go to get you checked out for M.E or even fibromyalgia.These can start after a trauma to the body of any sort. They also both give you the same symptoms as arthritis and rheumatism. For the pain ask for Tramadol and pregabalin.¬† Hope your sorted soon. Xxxxxx¬†
Posts.Title: arthiritis or side effcts from meds ?

Posts.Content: Hi ¬†I cldnt get the China so instead I pounded a pillow and screamed into it. Don't feel afraid to shout,scream or even cry. Nobody will blame you. Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: I don't know what to say now

Posts.Content: Hi Rubyroo try money.co.uk ¬†they can maybe help or even contact Macmillan themselves as they might be able to tell you of an insurance companies. You do have to be clear for five years though. I just put in my search engine life or travel insurance for cancer survivors. Hope this helps hunni xx
Posts.Title: Cancer Survivor struggling to get life insurance
